page.title: 07Life Styles.
page.content: Housing. The Village houses are mainly made of flint and cob walls, with slate roofs. Buildings in the 1960s were brick and tile. The 1970s are mock Georgian design. There are still some thatch cottages but a lot have been pulled down. The old cobblers shop is still visable and a number of water mills up the valley can still be identified. The school was build in 1859 and is a typical Victorian building. 2. Childrens Games. At present the children play games such as Green Gates where you have to do hand stands and the last one to fall is the winner. Sardines, where they all pack to gether tightly as many as they can. Stuck in the Tolet Pipe, a form of Hide-and-Seek, and other games with names like Little Pony, Flea Busters, Piggy Banks, Stunt men and Superbaby.
